member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.XForms.SfChart
member.summary: Represents a root class for chart which is used to plot a series of points in cartesian co-ordinate or visualize the points using non-cartesian chart types.
member.remarks: SfChart can plot multiple charts and used as a container view to display legend, axis and multiple chart series. Multiple chart series can be specified using property. Axis can be specified using and properties. Legend can be customized using property. Since SfChart is a container view for both cartesian and non-cartesian charts, it can plot either cartesian or non-cartesian chart at a time when the collection contains mixed chart types.

member.summary: Event that occurs when reset the zooming. The event argument contains information about axis, previous zoom factor, and previous zoom position.

member.summary: Event that occurs when start selection zooming. The event argument contains zoom rect.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.XForms.ChartZoomPanBehavior
member.summary: This class is used to enable zooming feature in . An instance of this class need to be added to collection.
member.remarks: Zooming and panning operations can be initiated and can be restored backed to the original position by performing zoom out operation or by enabling EnableDoubleTap property. Chart can also be zoomed, without adding ChartZoomPanBehavior, by specifying following properties ChartAxis.ZoomFactor and ChartAxis.ZoomPosition for the ChartAxis.By specifying zooming mode using ZoomMode property, zooming operation can be performed along horizontal or along vertical or along both directions in a Chart.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.XForms.BarSeries
member.summary: Represents a bar chart. To render bar chart, create an instance of this class and add it to collection property and set the required properties.
member.remarks: BarSeries is the transposed version of ColumnSeries. Unlike other cartesian chart types, to plot BarSeries, x-axis will be rendered vertically and y-axis will be rendered horizontally. Hence, it is not possible to plot other chart types along with BarSeries. Multiple BarSeries can be added in a single . BarSeries requires , and properties to be set to render the chart. This series also requires x-axis and y-axis to be explicitly set either using and or and .

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.XForms.StackingBar100Series
member.summary: To render a 100% stacked bar chart, create an instance of the StackingBar100Series class, and add it to collection property and set the required properties.
member.remarks: StackingBar100Series is the transposed version of StackingColumn100Series. Unlike other cartesian chart types, to plot StackingBarSeries, x-axis will be rendered vertically and y-axis will be rendered horizontally. Hence, it is not possible to plot other chart types along with StackingBarSeries. Multiple StackingBarSeries can be added in a single . StackingBarSeries requires, and properties to be set to render the chart. This series also requires x-axis and y-axis to be explicitly set either using and or and .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.RangeNavigator.XForms.SfDateTimeRangeNavigator.Intervals
member.summary: Gets or Sets the major and minor scale intervals. By default, Intervals contain all the components of DateTimeIntervalType. Based on the available size of the view, best possible interval component will be choosen for both major and minor scales. If you prefer to view only specific components, you can set only the required DateTimeIntervalType components using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.RangeNavigator.XForms.SfDateTimeRangeNavigator.EnableDeferredUpdate
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value that indicates whether the range changed event notification is deferred. Otherwise, range changed event will be notified for every movement of the thumbs which will degrade the scrolling performance if you are updating other views and do some time consuming tasks in the range changed event handler.
